data.title: [ci skip]add Tizen related talks to the Readme
Encapsule Audio Engine implementation for the platforms using OpenAL
data.body:
Currently, new AudioEngine uses the following technique:
- Android: OpenSLES
- Windows / Mac / iOS: OpenAL
- Linux: fmod  --> could be replaced with `OpenAL` too.
- Tizen: platform depended SDK

Except Android and Tizen, other platforms could all use OpenAL.
But now, we have separated folder for platforms using OpenAL, the bad thing is although they all use OpenAL , the source code are so different. :(

Perhaps, we need to encapsule this and only need `cocos/audio/openal` for these platforms that use OpenAL. In this way, it will be better for maintaining and better for adding new features.

Some folder structure may be like this:

```
cocos/audio/openal/AudioEngine-impl.cpp
cocos/audio/openal/AudioEngine-impl.h
cocos/audio/openal/PlatformSpecific.h
cocos/audio/openal/PlatformSpecific-win32.cpp
cocos/audio/openal/PlatformSpecific-osx.cpp
cocos/audio/openal/PlatformSpecific-ios.cpp
cocos/audio/openal/PlatformSpecific-linux.cpp
cocos/audio/openal/PlatformSpecific-winrt.cpp
```
#### Why Should We Need Specific?

Although they all use OpenAL to play sound, they should use platform dependence code to decode compressed file (.mp3/.ogg/.caf) into pcm buffer.

Any idea? @ricardoquesada @minggo .

data.title: Add explicit type casts to suppress -Wformat warnings
data.body:
The new Audio feature generates the following warnings when compiling with Android NDK r10d using GCC 4.9:

```
cocos/audio/android/AudioEngine-inl.cpp:222:118: warning: format '%d' expects argument of type 'int', but argument 4 has type 'cocos2d::experimental::IAudioPlayer::State' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/AudioMixerController.cpp:223:161: warning: format '%d' expects argument of type 'int', but argument 4 has type 'cocos2d::experimental::Track::State' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/AudioMixerController.cpp:234:161: warning: format '%d' expects argument of type 'int', but argument 4 has type 'cocos2d::experimental::Track::State' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/UrlAudioPlayer.cpp:172:165: warning: format '%d' expects argument of type 'int', but argument 5 has type 'cocos2d::experimental::IAudioPlayer::State' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/UrlAudioPlayer.cpp:186:156: warning: format '%d' expects argument of type 'int', but argument 5 has type 'cocos2d::experimental::IAudioPlayer::State' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/UrlAudioPlayer.cpp:200:156: warning: format '%d' expects argument of type 'int', but argument 5 has type 'cocos2d::experimental::IAudioPlayer::State' [-Wformat=]
cocos/audio/android/UrlAudioPlayer.cpp:214:169: warning: format '%d' expects argument of type 'int', but argument 5 has type 'cocos2d::experimental::IAudioPlayer::State' [-Wformat=]
```

This patch adds `static_cast<int>` to avoids the warnings. Thanks!

data.title: Use VSCode to debug cocos2d-x jsb with cocos2d-x 3.12 version, got timeout
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.12
- devices test on: win7
- developing environments
  - VS version: 2013, debug model

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download the cocos2d-x 3.12 from [Cocos2d-x site](http://www.cocos.com/download/cocos2d-x/)
2. Execute the setup.py.
3. Open the cocos2d-win32.sln solution and run the js-test project.
4. Open the js-test folder with VSCode and debug the project.
5. The VSCode console will show "retry socket.connet" until timeout.
6. I test the cocos2d-x version 3.11.1, it don't have this problem.
[Here is screenshot](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/use-vscode-to-debug-cocos2d-x-jsb-programs/27588/81?u=djong)

data.title: Fix format string warning when compiling for iOS armv7
data.body:
This pull request fixes the following warning when compiling libcocos2d for iOS armv7 (32-bit) on Xcode 7.3.1:

```
cocos/audio/apple/AudioEngine-inl.mm:70:70: values of type 'OSStatus' should not be used as format arguments; add an explicit cast to 'int' instead [-Wformat]
```

data.title: Will crash caused by missing `rand`
data.body:
If building with Android 21+ and running under 21, it will crash. The error message is

```
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: dlopen failed: cannot locate symbol "rand" referenced by xxx
```

It is because `libtiff` is built with Android 21+, and it uses `rand`, but `rand` is not defined under Android 21.

Edit: and cocos2d-x should use `std::rand` instead of `rand`.

data.title: Inefficient batch capacity resizing
data.body:
cocos2d-x version: 3.12
### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a label with string of 90 characters
2. Observe SpriteBatchNode increasing it's capacity 4 times. Each time memory is reseated, indices reinitialised and the GL buffers remapped.  
   29 -> 40  
   40 -> 54  
   54 -> 73  
   73 -> 98  
### Proposed solution:

Follow behaviour of std::vector:
When assigned initial content it's capacity will equal it's size. When new content is subsequently added std::vector doubles it's existing capacity. If new content would exceed the doubled capacity, match capacity exactly to fit.
e.g.

```
std::vector<int> vec = {1,2,3}; 
//initial: vec.capacity() == 3

vec.push_back(4); 
//double: vec.capacity() == 6

vec.insert(vec.end(), {5,6,7,8,9,10,11,12,13});
//double capacity would be 12, but as new content exceeds this we use content size instead
//content: vec.capacity() == 13
```

Furthermore we should expose ability to manually set capacity to allow developers to 'warm' labels they expect to be displaying large amounts of content in the future.
### References:

[Origin forum thread](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocos2d-x-version-3-xx-is-resize-textureatlast-capacity-a-problem/16408/9)

data.title: Tilemap Bug
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.12
- devices test on: Browser
- developing environments
  - NDK version: 10e
  - Xcode version:
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version: Chrome newest

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Load a tmx tilemap, and tileset texture file.
2. Error at: CCTMXLayer.js, line 115.
3. How to fix: at line 117, change "tex" to "texID".
